weekday_indexed() = default;

{{dcl|num=2|since=c++20|
constexpr weekday_indexed( const std::chrono::weekday&amp; wd, unsigned index ) noexcept;

Constructs a {{tt|weekday_indexed}}.

@1@ Default constructor leaves both the {{lc|std::chrono::weekday}} and the index value uninitialized.
@2@ Constructs a {{lc|std::chrono::weekday_indexed|weekday_indexed}} storing the weekday {{c|wd}} and the index {{c|index}}. The values held are unspecified if {{c|1=!wd.ok() {{!!}} index &gt; 7}}.

===Notes===
A more convenient way to construct a {{lc|std::chrono::weekday_indexed|weekday_indexed}} is with {{lc|std::chrono::weekday|weekday}}'s {{c|operator[]}}, i.e., {{c|wd[index]}}.

===Example===
{{example
|code=
#include &lt;chrono&gt;
#include &lt;iostream&gt;
using namespace std::chrono;

int main()
{
    constexpr auto third_friday = weekday_indexed(Friday, 3); // uses constructor (2)
    static_assert(third_friday == Friday[3]);

    weekday_indexed wdi = Tuesday[2]; // represents the 2nd Tuesday
    std::cout &lt;&lt; year_month_day{ wdi / October / 2019y } &lt;&lt; '\n';
}
|p=true
|output=
2019-10-08
}}
